definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: The Chinese called it a coincidence.
sentences.chinese: 而中方稱此爲一個巧合。

sentences.english: It came back down to Earth on a parachute and – fittingly – landed in a Christmas tree plantation near Basingstoke.
sentences.chinese: 巧合的是，它降落在貝辛斯托克附近的一棵聖誕樹上。

sentences.english: Pay attention to coincidences that you experience each day by looking for them.
sentences.chinese: 你從每天的經歷中都可以找到這些，注意這些巧合吧。

sentences.english: These changes simply couldn't be dismissed as coincidences.
sentences.chinese: 這些改變不能被簡單地當做巧合。

sentences.english: Quest, question, there is no coincidence that there is an etymological link between the two.
sentences.chinese: 探索，問題，這兩者在詞源上有所關聯並非巧合。

sentences.english: If they resolve to the same value, it is purely coincidental.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們分解後是同樣的值，那麼這是完全巧合的。

sentences.english: Some say this is no coincidence.
Out-on-loan winger Bebe is, coincidentally, also out injured.
sentences.chinese: 巧合的是，即使租借在外的貝貝也受傷了。

sentences.english: The timing of the North’s deadly attacks on the South this year isn’t a coincidence; the Kim Dynasty is in self-preservation mode.
sentences.chinese: 對韓國致命攻擊並非巧合，金氏王朝僅在自我保護。

sentences.english: A golden cross may mean something or it might just be a coincidence.
sentences.chinese: 黃金交叉或許有重大意義，又或許只是巧合而已。

sentences.english: Life is full of coincidences, two parallels will intersect one day!
sentences.chinese: 生命中充滿巧合，兩條平行錢也會有相交的一天。

sentences.english: Lennon, almost incidentally, had one of the best voices in rock.
sentences.chinese: 而列儂，幾近是過於巧合，擁有一副唱搖滾的好嗓子。

sentences.english: And, coincidently, what is the partial of energy with respect to distance?
sentences.chinese: 巧合的是，能量對距離的導數是什麼？

sentences.english: And there are no such things as coincidences.
sentences.chinese: 而且有沒有這樣的巧合的事情。

sentences.english: Is that an example of precognition or just coincidence?
sentences.chinese: 這是預言的一種還是隻是一個巧合罷了？

sentences.english: It's no coincidence that the rise of open source closely followed the rise of the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 這並非巧合，開源的興起繼之互聯網興起而來。

definition: as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right
to make a conscious effort/to do something deliberately
in the unseen world of spirits/mysteriously and inexorably
